intro: Crepis sibthorpiana, commonly known as the Sibthorp's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are hairy and often lobed, while its small, yellowish flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Crepis sibthorpiana is a perennial herb that plays a role in its native ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small invertebrates.
